p: The fruits extract showed highest inhibition against the bacterial strains than seed and bark extracts. The ZOI of fruits against B. subtilis was 16.24 mm (wild) and 17.04 (cultivated); Escherichia faecalis 14.28 mm (wild) and 14.62 mm (cultivated); MRSA 15.02 mm (wild) and 16.28 mm (cultivated); and Staphylococcus epidermidis 16.38 mm (wild) and 16.19 mm (cultivated). The seed extracts showed moderate activities against the tested organisms. The ZOI of seeds for Bacillus subtilis was 15.72 mm (wild) and 16.28 mm (cultivated); MRSA 17.79 mm (wild) and 16.44 mm (cultivated); and Staphylococcus epidermidis 15.58 mm (wild) and 13.25 mm (cultivated). The ZOI of bark extract against MRSA was 14.30 mm (wild) and 13.28 mm (cultivated), and that for Staphylococcus aureus was 17.02 mm (wild) and 16.44 (cultivated) ( Table 1).
